visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a chart with the following specifications: Chart type: arearange, Chart title: 'Temperature variation by day', Axes and labels styling: X-axis should be datetime, Y-axis title should be empty, Tooltip should have crosshairs, shared, valueSuffix '°C', and xDateFormat '%A, %b %e', Data series: One series named 'Temperatures' with data fetched from 'https://www.highcharts.com/samples/data/range.json', Custom colors: Gradient from red to blue for the series, Additional configurations: Zooming type 'x', scrollablePlotArea with minWidth 600 and scrollPositionX 1.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render an 'arearange' chart with a title 'Temperature variation by day'. The X-axis is set to display datetime values, while the Y-axis title is left empty. The tooltip is styled with crosshairs, shared mode, a value suffix of '°C', and a date format that displays the day of the week and the month and day. The data series is named 'Temperatures' and is expected to be populated with data fetched from a specified URL. The series color is a gradient that transitions from red to blue, and the legend symbol color is set to a custom purple. Additional configurations include enabling X-axis zooming and setting up a scrollable plot area with a minimum width of 600 pixels and a scroll position of 1.
